message.content:
Did you know that the Gupta Empire, located in present-day India, was one of the most prominent civilizations of the 5th and 6th century? Let's dig in 🧵

The Gupta Empire was known for its strong centralized government and Hinduism as the dominant religion. Sanskrit was the language of the elite, while Prakrit was used by the common people. Their advancements in mathematics and astronomy were unparalleled.

Chandragupta II, also known as Vikramaditya, was an influential leader during this time. He was known for his military conquests, patronage of the arts, and his promotion of Hinduism. He even had a court poet, Kalidasa, who wrote some of the most famous Sanskrit works of literature.

The Gupta Empire's influence can still be seen in modern-day India. Their art, architecture, and literature continue to inspire and influence Indian culture. Even the decimal system and the concept of zero, developed during this time, are still used in mathematics today.

However, the practice of Sati, where a widow would throw herself onto her husband's funeral pyre, was a common and controversial practice during this time. It was outlawed by the British in the 19th century.

The Gupta Empire eventually declined due to invasions by the Huns and internal conflicts. By the mid-6th century, the empire had disintegrated. 

Hope you enjoyed. See you next time 👋
Follow @HistoryOfCiv for more on past civilizations.
